Norville Barnes.action: Apologizes sincerely to Buzz for firing him and admits he was 'a little funny in the head'.
Norville Barnes.assessment: Norville shows remorse and a desire to make amends, indicating a good-natured and sincere attitude.

Norville Barnes.action: Does not retaliate or respond aggressively after being punched by Buzz.
Norville Barnes.assessment: Norville's non-retaliation indicates tolerance and restraint, which are aspects of warmth.

Norville Barnes.action: Norville trudges on, faster, sweatier, and runs into Buzz, appearing dazed and apologetic.

Norville Barnes.action: Norville apologizes profusely to Buzz for firing him and admits he was 'a little funny in the head'.

Norville Barnes.action: Norville staggers to his feet and bursts through the crowd, running away from pursuers.
Norville Barnes.assessment: This shows some physical ability to recover and attempt escape under pressure, indicating a basic level of competence in a stressful situation.

Norville Barnes.action: Norville crashes into a wall while running and appears disoriented and gasping.

Norville Barnes.action: Norville manages to evade the crowd momentarily by turning down an alley that the pursuers miss.

Norville Barnes.action: Norville staggers into the lobby and looks dumbly at the heroic statue of himself.

Norville Barnes.action: Norville pushes past the sign painter who is defacing his office door.

Norville Barnes.action: Norville puts on his old mailroom apron after being replaced as president.

Norville Barnes.action: Staggers into the lobby and stares dumbly at his own heroic statue.

Norville Barnes.action: Pushes past the sign painter who is defacing his office door.

Norville Barnes.action: Throws open the window and climbs out onto the ledge.

Norville Barnes.action: Trips and falls, then catches himself on the icy ledge by his fingertips.

Norville Barnes.action: Looks up over his shoulder at distant singing and a figure flying toward him from the stars.

Norville Barnes.action: Corrects Mr. Hudsucker politely when he calls him 'Norman'.

Norville Barnes.action: Reflects on his lost idealism and expresses regret for trading hopes and dreams for power and wealth.

Norville Barnes.action: Reads a reflective and self-critical letter aloud, showing awareness of personal and professional decline.

Norville Barnes.action: Continues reading despite Hudsucker's emotional interruption and request to skip a part.

Norville Barnes.action: Expresses feelings of loneliness and failure in preserving his ideals and character over time.

Norville Barnes.action: Urges Sid to work closely with the new president and to keep giving Hudsucker Industries all his energies, but not his soul, emphasizing the importance of striving for success without worshiping it.
